titlestmt.titleproper: Otto Lambert Grever and Grever family papers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:56:09 -0400.

did.unittitle: Otto Lambert Grever and Grever family papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eight pencil drawings by Grever; biographical and legal papers; printed material from the Kit Kat Club, 1907-1923, and the Salmagundi Club, 1929; membership books from the Poster Artists Association of America, 1912, 1915, and 1923; photograph albums and photographs; letters of condolence upon Grever's death; and correspondence of Grever's widow and daughter, Barbara Grever, mainly relating to their efforts in documenting Grever's work after his death.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Theatrical poster artist, lithographer; New York, N.Y. Grever was born in Cincinnati, Ohio, May 16, 1878. He studied art at the Cincinnati Art Academy under Frank Duveneck and Vincent Nowottny. He began his career in lithography in Cincinatti, eventually settling in New York City in 1904 and working for the H.C. Miner Lithographic Co. where he specialized in theatrical posters for 29 years.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Grever's daughter, Barbara Ann Grever, 1993-1994.
